fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Budget, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Communication
eu_initiatives:
The Foundation spearheads initiatives across four core programs: 
1)    Investing in Future Generations: 
Education and Health Rights Advocacy and Campaigning for Improved Quality and Access to Services for childhood, parenthood and youth 
2)    Democratic Governance 
Improving Democratic Governance through Strengthening of Fair and Democratic Institutions 
3)    Sustainable Social Growth 
Supporting Economic Development through Social Innovations and Technology Transfer for Improved Human Development in Kyrgyz Republic, including regional cooperation, human capital development, social innovations and social entrepreneurship 
4)    Diversity and Culture as Access to World Values 
Supporting accessibility to arts, music, and literature in Kyrgyzstan to the disadvantaged and vulnerable groups of population. 
 
The Foundation currently implements its four core programs for key beneficiary and stakeholder groups.
organisation_name: The "Roza Otunbayeva Initiative" International Public Foundation (ROI IPF)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
We are members of Asia-Pacific Regional Network for Early Childhood (ARNEC) 
 
http://www.arnec.net/community/partners/#partner-15
goals__remit: The “Roza Otunbayeva Initiative” International Public Foundation (IPF) began operating in January 2012. The main objective of the Foundation is to implement programs and projects that will contribute to the social, political and economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic.
relevant_communication:
The Foundation leads initiatives in four main areas: 
  
Investing in Future Generations: Implementing promotions and campaigns in the fields of education, science, culture, art, personal development, healthy lifestyles, quality of life and services for children, mothers and young people.
